author: Ali Miller Richards
text:
Stop the Beach Renourishment v. Florida Department of Environmental Protection looked at whether the state’s legislation to restore storm-eroded beaches along the ocean or lakeshores, modifying the private property boundary line, amounts to a judicial taking or violates the due process clause. On June 17, the U.S. Supreme Court upheld, 8-0, the state's decision but was split evenly over the broader issue.
